segments.en: Numbered Discourses 10
3. The Great Chapter
23. Body

segments.pli: “Atthi, bhikkhave, dhammā kāyena pahātabbā, no vācāya.
segments.en: “Mendicants, there are things that should be given up by the body, not by speech.

segments.pli: Atthi, bhikkhave, dhammā vācāya pahātabbā, no kāyena.
segments.en: There are things that should be given up by speech, not by the body.

segments.pli: Atthi, bhikkhave, dhammā neva kāyena pahātabbā no vācāya, paññāya disvā pahātabbā.
segments.en: There are things that should be given up neither by the body, nor by speech, but by seeing again and again with wisdom.

segments.pli: Katame ca, bhikkhave, dhammā kāyena pahātabbā, no vācāya?
segments.en: And what are the things that should be given up by the body, not by speech?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu akusalaṃ āpanno hoti kiñci desaṃ kāyena.
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant has committed a certain unskillful offense by way of body.
After examination, sensible spiritual companions say this to them:

segments.pli: ‘āyasmā kho akusalaṃ āpanno kiñci desaṃ kāyena.
segments.en: ‘Venerable, you’ve committed a certain unskillful offense by way of body.

segments.pli: Sādhu vatāyasmā kāyaduccaritaṃ pahāya kāyasucaritaṃ bhāvetū’ti.
segments.en: Please give up that bad bodily conduct and develop good bodily conduct.’

segments.pli: So anuvicca viññūhi sabrahmacārīhi vuccamāno kāyaduccaritaṃ pahāya kāyasucaritaṃ bhāveti.
segments.en: When spoken to by their sensible spiritual companions they give up that bad bodily conduct and develop good bodily conduct.

segments.pli: Ime vuccanti, bhikkhave, dhammā kāyena pahātabbā, no vācāya.
segments.en: These are the things that should be given up by the body, not by speech.

segments.pli: Katame ca, bhikkhave, dhammā vācāya pahātabbā, no kāyena?
segments.en: And what are the things that should be given up by speech, not by the body?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu akusalaṃ āpanno hoti kiñci desaṃ vācāya.
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant has committed a certain unskillful offense by way of speech.
After examination, sensible spiritual companions say this to them:

segments.pli: ‘āyasmā kho akusalaṃ āpanno kiñci desaṃ vācāya.
segments.en: ‘Venerable, you’ve committed a certain unskillful offense by way of speech.

segments.pli: Sādhu vatāyasmā vacīduccaritaṃ pahāya vacīsucaritaṃ bhāvetū’ti.
segments.en: Please give up that bad verbal conduct and develop good verbal conduct.’

segments.pli: So anuvicca viññūhi sabrahmacārīhi vuccamāno vacīduccaritaṃ pahāya vacīsucaritaṃ bhāveti.
segments.en: When spoken to by their sensible spiritual companions they give up that bad verbal conduct and develop good verbal conduct.

segments.pli: Ime vuccanti, bhikkhave, dhammā vācāya pahātabbā, no kāyena.
segments.en: These are the things that should be given up by speech, not by the body.

segments.pli: Katame ca, bhikkhave, dhammā neva kāyena pahātabbā no vācāya, paññāya disvā pahātabbā?
segments.en: And what are the things that should be given up neither by the body, nor by speech, but by seeing again and again with wisdom?

segments.pli: Lobho, bhikkhave, neva kāyena pahātabbo no vācāya, paññāya disvā pahātabbo.
segments.en: Greed …
hate …
delusion …
anger …
hostility …
offensiveness …
contempt …

segments.pli: macchariyaṃ, bhikkhave, neva kāyena pahātabbaṃ no vācāya, paññāya disvā pahātabbaṃ.
segments.en: and stinginess are things that should be given up neither by the body, nor by speech, but by seeing again and again with wisdom.

segments.pli: Pāpikā, bhikkhave, issā neva kāyena pahātabbā no vācāya, paññāya disvā pahātabbā.
segments.en: Nasty jealousy should be given up neither by the body, nor by speech, but by seeing again and again with wisdom.
And what is nasty jealousy?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ijjhati gahapatissa vā gahapatiputtassa vā dhanena vā dhaññena vā rajatena vā jātarūpena vā.
segments.en: It’s when a householder or their child is prospering in money, grain, silver, or gold.

segments.pli: Tatrāññatarassa dāsassa vā upavāsassa vā evaṃ hoti:
segments.en: And a bondservant or dependent thinks:

segments.pli: ‘aho vatimassa gahapatissa vā gahapatiputtassa vā na ijjheyya dhanena vā dhaññena vā rajatena vā jātarūpena vā’ti.
segments.en: ‘Oh, may that householder or their child not prosper in money, grain, silver, or gold!’

segments.pli: Samaṇo vā pana brāhmaṇo vā lābhī hoti cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānapaccayabhesajjaparikkhārānaṃ.
segments.en: Or an ascetic or brahmin receives robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.

segments.pli: Tatrāññatarassa samaṇassa vā brāhmaṇassa vā evaṃ hoti:
segments.en: And some other ascetic or brahmin thinks:
‘Oh, may that ascetic or brahmin not receive robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.’
This is called nasty jealousy.

segments.pli: Pāpikā, bhikkhave, icchā neva kāyena pahātabbā no vācāya, paññāya disvā pahātabbā.
segments.en: Corrupt wishes should be given up neither by the body, nor by speech, but by seeing again and again with wisdom.
And what are corrupt wishes?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco assaddho samāno ‘saddhoti maṃ jāneyyun’ti icchati;
segments.en: It’s when a faithless person wishes to be known as faithful.
An unethical person wishes to be known as ethical.
An uneducated person wishes to be known as learned.
A lover of company wishes to be known as secluded.
A lazy person wishes to be known as energetic.
An unmindful person wishes to be known as mindful.
A person without immersion wishes to be known as having immersion.
A witless person wishes to be known as wise.
A person who has not ended the defilements wishes to be known as having ended the defilements.
These are called corrupt wishes.

segments.pli: Ime vuccanti, bhikkhave, dhammā neva kāyena pahātabbā no vācāya, paññāya disvā pahātabbā.
segments.en: Corrupt wishes should be given up neither by the body, nor by speech, but by seeing again and again with wisdom.

segments.pli: Tañce, bhikkhave, bhikkhuṃ lobho abhibhuyya iriyati,
segments.en: Suppose that greed masters that mendicant and keeps going.
Or that hate …
delusion …
anger …
hostility …
offensiveness …
contempt …
stinginess …
nasty jealousy …
or corrupt wishes master them and keep going.
You should know of them:

segments.pli: ‘nāyamāyasmā tathā pajānāti yathā pajānato lobho na hoti, tathāhimaṃ āyasmantaṃ lobho abhibhuyya iriyati;
segments.en: ‘This venerable does not have the understanding that would eliminate greed, so greed masters them and keeps going.

segments.pli: nāyamāyasmā tathā pajānāti yathā pajānato doso na hoti …
segments.en: They don’t have the understanding that would eliminate hate …
delusion …
anger …
hostility …
offensiveness …
contempt …
stinginess …
nasty jealousy …

segments.pli: pāpikā icchā na hoti, tathāhimaṃ āyasmantaṃ pāpikā icchā abhibhuyya iriyatī’ti.
segments.en: or corrupt wishes, so corrupt wishes master them and keep going.’

segments.pli: Tañce, bhikkhave, bhikkhuṃ lobho nābhibhuyya iriyati,
segments.en: Suppose that greed does not master that mendicant and keep going.
Or that hate …
delusion …
anger …
hostility …
offensiveness …
contempt …
stinginess …
nasty jealousy …
or corrupt wishes don’t master that mendicant and keep going.
You should know of them:

segments.pli: ‘tathā ayamāyasmā pajānāti yathā pajānato lobho na hoti, tathāhimaṃ āyasmantaṃ lobho nābhibhuyya iriyati;
segments.en: ‘This venerable has the understanding that eliminates greed, so greed doesn’t master them and keep going.

segments.pli: tathā ayamāyasmā pajānāti yathā pajānato doso na hoti …
segments.en: They have the understanding that eliminates hate …
delusion …
anger …
hostility …
offensiveness …
contempt …
stinginess …
nasty jealousy …

segments.pli: pāpikā icchā na hoti, tathāhimaṃ āyasmantaṃ pāpikā icchā nābhibhuyya iriyatī’”ti.
segments.en: and corrupt wishes, so corrupt wishes don’t master them and keep going.’”

sections.title: “Mendicants, there are things that should be given up…

suttaplex.blurb: Some things are to be given by by body, others by speech, and still others by wisdom.
